author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: الَّذِيْ انْقَطَعَتْ أَفْئِدَةُ العُرَفآءِ عَنْ عِرْفانِ صُنْعِكَ الَّذِيْ خَلَقْتَهُ بِإِرادَتِكَ فَكَيْفَ الصُّعُودُ إِلى سَمَواتِ قُدْسِ مَشِيَّتِكَ أَوِ الْوُرُودُ فِي سُرادِقِ عِرْفانِ نَفْسِكَ، سُبْحانَكَ اللَّهُمَّ يا إِلهِي
translation: Glorified, glorified be Thou, O my God! How can I ever hope to ascend into the heaven of Thy most holy will, or gain admittance into the tabernacle of Thy Divine knowledge, knowing as I do that the minds of the wise and learned are impotent to fathom the secrets of Thy handiwork—a handiwork which is itself but a creation of Thy will?
